instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power
threads.message:
Customer told Coffee was dropped on it. Actually it looks really clean.

However I noticed that if everything is plugged it gives me 5.15V on the power cord amp meter PPBUS = 0v. 

If I unplug that cable which connects the sound and I guess the power button to the board itself it goes to 20V. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.58V

However no image on the screen, no fan spin, and no external image.

Could it only be to replace the power button?
Does this model of logic board do not have auto power on? First time with this brand new model.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power
threads.message:
Machine should turn on by itself, when charger is connected.
Also pressing any key, trackpad clik, or open lid.

Liquid spill on audio board is very dangerous for T2.
Some T2 data lines are connected there.
Leakage from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to data lines is a classic issue on this board.

Inspect audio board on both sides.
Touch ID may be also corroded.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power
threads.message:
Yeah the audio board seems to burned.

I tried many times to turn on the machine without audio board connected but it's totally dead. I guess I need to buy a new audio board to go ahead. How about to Touch ID is there any test I can do beyond visual inspection?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power
threads.message:
BTW

Removed the audio board
 The other side is really clean and good the bad side is the one when you open the lid.
Its in short. I even tried removing some small caps... But its total garbabe.

Since without this board the machine should AUTO POWER on. Where should I go from here?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power
threads.message: This is my amp meter plugged in

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power
threads.message:
Board should start by itself with J6100 disconnected.

Check diode mode to ground on all T2 related lines going to J6100.
